title: Dealing with the Dry | Agronomist Drew Penberthy

tasks.task: Organizing staff engagement and mental health support during drought
subtasks: Implement infrastructure projects (e.g., fencing, soil works, erosion control) to keep staff engaged
Invest in water management systems for efficient use during potential rainfall
Encourage staff to take holidays and family time to improve mental health
Provide access to free courses and training opportunities through funding
Consider relocating staff temporarily to other jobs that utilize farm equipment during downtime
Acknowledge and support the role of wives and family members in managing stress during drought periods

tasks.task: Adapting farm management strategies in response to drought conditions
subtasks: Prioritize infrastructure improvements to enhance farm resilience (e.g., better fencing, soil stabilization)
Prepare for potential rapid moisture uptake when rain occurs by having proper water management structures in place
Leverage available government funding for staff training and skill development
Plan alternative employment opportunities for staff during prolonged drought periods

tasks.task: Maintaining family well-being during prolonged drought stress
subtasks: Encourage families to engage in recreational activities and take breaks to alleviate stress
Address the emotional impact on family members, including wives and children, who are affected by the drought
Recognize the additional burden on family members and provide support mechanisms for them

tasks.task: 1. **Organizing Staff Engagement and Mental Health Support During Drought (MAINTASK)**
